com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects

Class FriendlyUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orbischallenge.game.SidedModel<com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.cores.UnitCore>
      • com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.UnitClient
        • com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.FriendlyUnit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.interfaces.IUnit, java.lang.Comparable<com.orbischallenge.ctz.objects.interfaces.IUnit>

    public class FriendlyUnit
extends UnitClient
    This class represents a unit your AI can control. It can be given various orders, and has various attributes such as health and position. Created by Orbis Access (Canada) Ltd on 07/06/2016.

    • Method Detail

      • checkMove

        public MoveResult checkMove(Point destination)
        Checks whether this unit can move one tile on the path to the given Point. This will use the built in path-finding system to find the next move along the shortest path. Does not actually move the unit. This check does not take into account the positions of friendly and enemy units as they might change by the time the move is actually performed.
        Parameters:
        destination - The point to move towards.
        Returns:
        The expected result if you were to try to move. If this is NO_MOVE_ATTEMPTED, then a path could not be found to the destination point.

      • checkMove

        public MoveResult checkMove(Direction direction)
        Checks whether this unit can move one tile in the given direction. Does not actually move the unit. This check does not take into account the positions of friendly and enemy units as they might change by the time the move is actually performed.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to check.
        Returns:
        The expected result if you were to try to move.

      • move

        public MoveResult move(Direction direction)
        Orders this Unit to move one tile in the given direction at the end of this turn. Note that the unit will not move until the turn is over.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to move in
        Returns:
        The result of attempting to make this move. If this is MOVE_VALID, this does not guarantee the move will succeed. The move will succeed ONLY if no enemy or friendly stays in, or attempts to move to the tile in the given Direction. Thus you won't know the final result of the move until the current turn completes. You can find out the result of the move from the previous turn from getLastMoveResult().

      • move

        public MoveResult move(Point destination)
        Orders this unit to move one tile towards the given destination. This will use the built in path-finding system to find the next move along the shortest path.
        Parameters:
        destination - The point to move towards.
        Returns:
        The result of attempting to make this move. If this is NO_MOVE_ATTEMPTED, then a path could not be found to the destination point. If this is MOVE_VALID, this does not guarantee the move will succeed. The move will succeed ONLY if no enemy or friendly stays in, or attempts to move to the tile in the given Direction. Thus you won't know the final result of the move until the current turn completes. You can find out the result of the move from the previous turn from getLastMoveResult().

      • getLastMoveResult

        public MoveResult getLastMoveResult()
        Returns the result of executing a move in the previous turn. If this unit did not try to move in the previous turn, then this will be MoveResult.NO_MOVE_ATTEMPTED

      • checkShotAgainstEnemy

        public ShotResult checkShotAgainstEnemy(EnemyUnit enemyUnit)
        Checks the expected result if this unit tries to shoot the given enemy unit with shootAt(enemyUnit);.
        Parameters:
        enemyUnit - The enemy unit to try to check the shot against.
        Returns:
        The expected result if you tried to shoot this enemy unit.

      • shootAt

        public ShotResult shootAt(EnemyUnit enemyUnit)
        Orders this Unit to fire its weapon at the given enemy unit at the end of this turn. Note that damage will not be applied until the turn is over.
        Parameters:
        enemyUnit - The enemy unit to shoot at.
        Returns:
        The result of trying to shoot the enemy.

      • getLastShotResult

        public ShotResult getLastShotResult()
        Returns the result of executing a shot in the previous turn. If this unit did not try to shoot in the previous turn, then this will be ShotResult.NO_SHOT_ATTEMPTED

      • getLastPickupResult

        public PickupResult getLastPickupResult()
        Returns the result of trying to obtain a pick up in the previous turn. If this unit did not try to obtain a pick up in the previous turn, then this will be PickupResult.NO_PICK_UP_ATTEMPTED

      • getLastShieldActivationResult

        public ActivateShieldResult getLastShieldActivationResult()
        Returns the result of trying to activate a shield in the previous turn. If this unit did not try to activate a shield, then this will be ActivateShieldResult.NO_SHIELD_ACTIVATION_ATTEMPTED

      • activateShield

        public ActivateShieldResult activateShield()
        Orders the unit to activate a shield this turn.

        If the unit is dead, returns ActivateShieldResult.UNIT_DEAD, if the unit has no shields, returns ActivateShieldResult.NO_SHIELDS_AVAILABLE, otherwise returns ActivateShieldResult.SHIELD_ACTIVATION_VALID.

        You can check how many shields this unit has with UnitClient.getNumShields()

      • checkShieldActivation

        public ActivateShieldResult checkShieldActivation()
        Check the result of trying to activate a shield.

        If the unit is dead, returns ActivateShieldResult.UNIT_DEAD, if the unit has no shields, returns ActivateShieldResult.NO_SHIELDS_AVAILABLE, otherwise returns ActivateShieldResult.SHIELD_ACTIVATION_VALID.

      • getEnemiesWhoShotMeLastTurn

        public EnemyUnit[] getEnemiesWhoShotMeLastTurn()
        Returns an array of Enemy Units (in no particular order) who damaged this Friendly Unit in the previous turn.

      • getDamageTakenLastTurn

        public int getDamageTakenLastTurn()
        Returns the total damage inflicted to this Friendly Unit in the previous turn.

      • standby

        public void standby()
        Orders this unit to do nothing and stay in place this turn.

      • checkPickupResult

        public PickupResult checkPickupResult()
        Check the result of trying to pick up whatever is under this unit's feet.

        If the unit is dead, returns PickupResult.UNIT_DEAD, if there is nothing there, returns PickupResult.NOTHING_TO_PICK_UP, otherwise returns PickupResult.PICK_UP_VALID.

        You can check the type of pick up with World.getPickupAtPosition(Point)

      • didLastActionSucceed

        public boolean didLastActionSucceed()
        Returns true iff this unit was able to successfully execute its action last turn.

      • pickupItemAtPosition

        public PickupResult pickupItemAtPosition()
        Orders this unit to pick up the item at its feet.

        If the unit is dead, returns PickupResult.UNIT_DEAD, if there is nothing there, returns PickupResult.NOTHING_TO_PICK_UP, otherwise returns PickupResult.PICK_UP_VALID.
